subject: Re: [junit] Junit data mapping
msgSnippet: Vinaya, I d love to help, but I m a little confused.  What do you feel is making writing such a test difficult?  For example, do the data mappings not have
messageBody:
Vinaya,

I'd love to help, but I'm a little confused. What do you feel is making
writing such a test difficult? For example, do the data mappings not
have clean Java API's? Do the tests you write feel repetitive? Or is
it something else? Thanks,

David Saff

Vinaya Kumar S wrote:
> Hi All,
>
> In project I have data maps extensively. I mean I convert object of
> once class to object of another class. For eg:
> Class Person
> {
> String firstName;
> String lastName
> }
>
> Class Employee
> {
> String name
> String SurName
> }
> Person.firstName=Person.name
> Person.lastName=Employee.SurName
> This is the simple example I gave, I have quite complext such mapping.
> I create maps using a tool.
> I am looking for writing a junit to test whether destination object is
> having correct information from source object. Do u have anyu suggestions?
